title: Self-Directed Learning Design Workshop for Computational Thinking Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental computer science concepts and foundational knowledge of instructional methodologies
context.additional_context: A short-term intensive course for in-service secondary school teachers to design LMS-based self-directed learning environments and enhance computational thinking education capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of computational thinking (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithm design) with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can critically analyze three or more CT educational materials using a self-directed learning module evaluation checklist.
Learners can collaboratively develop one CT-based science lesson design with peer teachers using LMS collaboration tools.

resources: LMS Platform (Video, Quiz, Discussion Board Features)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
